description: The STIX ID of an identity object. Used to track the identity of the individual or organization which created the current version of the object.
The created_by_ref property specifies the id property of the identity object that describes the entity that created this object.
The object_marking_refs property specifies a list of id properties of marking-definition objects that apply to this object.

The tactic_refs array of the matrix contains an ordered list of x-mitre-tactic STIX IDs corresponding to the tactics of the matrix. The order of tactic_refs determines the order the tactics should appear within the matrix.

The created_by_ref property specifies the id property of the identity object that describes the entity that created this object.
The object_marking_refs property specifies a list of id properties of marking-definition objects that apply to this object.
A list of events tied to this incident. It MUST contain references to one or more Event objects.
A list of impacts of this incident. It MUST contain references to one or more Impact objects. The objects referenced in this list MUST be of type impact
A list of all SDO, SCO and SRO objects contained in this incident, not including Task, Event, Impact or Sequence objects. It MUST contain references to one or more SDO, SCO or SRO objects.
A list of Sequence Start objects tied to this incident. It MUST contain references only to Sequence objects.
A list of ence objects tied to this incident. It MUST contain references only to Sequence objects, where the step_type property is set to start_step.
A list of tasks tied to this incident. It MUST contain references to one or more Task objects.
The created_by_ref property specifies the id property of the identity object that describes the entity that created this object.
The object_marking_refs property specifies a list of id properties of marking-definition objects that apply to this object.
An optional list of sighting objects that were related to this event. Sightings referenced in this SHOULD be based on attack-pattern, indicator, or malware SDOs.

The initial object state that this event affected. If the result_ref is not populated then this MUST be populated. If there is no result state this typically means that this event removed or resolved the initial object. For example, an event or task resolved a network outage.
The final state that this event influenced. If the initial_ref is populated this MUST reference the same type of SDO.
The created_by_ref property specifies the id property of the identity object that describes the entity that created this object.
The object_marking_refs property specifies a list of id properties of marking-definition objects that apply to this object.
A list of all impacted entities or infrastructure. This can relate directly to Infrastructure, SCOs, and other SDOs.
The referenced impact supersedes this one at the end_time for the current impact. This allows capturing how the severity of this impact changes over time.
The object_marking_refs property specifies a list of id properties of marking-definition objects that apply to this object.
A list of all impacted entities or infrastructure. This can relate directly to Infrastructure, SCOs, and other SDOs.

The initial object state that this event affected. If the result_ref is not populated then this MUST be populated. If there is no result state this typically means that this event removed or resolved the initial object. For example, an event or task resolved a network outage.
The final state that this event influenced. If the initial_ref is populated this MUST reference the same type of SDO.
The referenced impact supersedes this one at the end_time for the current impact. This allows capturing how the severity of this impact changes over time.
The object_marking_refs property specifies a list of id properties of marking-definition objects that apply to this object.

The sequence object to follow, MUST be of type sequence

The sequence objects to follow, MUST be of type sequence

The operating systems that the malware family or malware instance is executable on. This applies to virtualized operating systems as well as those running on bare metal.

The sample_refs property specifies a list of identifiers of the SCO file or artifact objects associated with this malware instance(s) or family. If is_family is false, then all samples listed in sample_refs MUST refer to the same binary data.
The created_by_ref property specifies the id property of the identity object that describes the entity that created this object.
The object_marking_refs property specifies a list of id properties of marking-definition objects that apply to this object.
A description of the virtual machine environment used to host the guest operating system (if applicable) that was used for the dynamic analysis of the malware instance or family.
The operating system used for the dynamic analysis of the malware instance or family. This applies to virtualized operating systems as well as those running on bare metal.
Any non-standard software installed on the operating system (specified through the operating-system value) used for the dynamic analysis of the malware instance or family.
This property contains the references to the STIX Cyber-observable Objects that were captured during the analysis process.
This property contains the reference to the SCO file, network traffic or artifact object that this malware analysis was performed against.

A list of SCOs and SROs representing the observation. The object_refs MUST contain at least one SCO reference if defined. The object_refs MAY include multiple SCOs and their corresponding SROs, if those SCOs are related as part of a single observation.

An ID reference to the SDO that was sighted (e.g., Indicator or Malware).

A list of ID references to the Identity or Location objects describing the entities or types of entities that saw the sighting.

Specifies a list of references to other File and/or Directory objects contained within the directory.
The object_marking_refs property specifies a list of id properties of marking-definition objects that apply to this object.
Specifies a list of references to one or more IP addresses or domain names that the domain name resolves to.
The object_marking_refs property specifies a list of id properties of marking-definition objects that apply to this object.
Specifies the user account that the email address belongs to, as a reference to a User Account object.
The object_marking_refs property specifies a list of id properties of marking-definition objects that apply to this object.

Specifies the value of the "From:" header of the email message. The "From:" field specifies the author of the message, that is, the mailbox(es) of the person or system responsible for the writing of the message.
Specifies the value of the "Sender" field of the email message. The "Sender:" field specifies the mailbox of the agent responsible for the actual transmission of the message.
Specifies the mailboxes that are "To:" recipients of the email message.
Specifies the mailboxes that are "CC:" recipients of the email message.
Specifies the mailboxes that are "BCC:" recipients of the email message.
Specifies the raw binary contents of the email message, including both the headers and body, as a reference to an Artifact object
Specifies the contents of non-textual MIME parts, that is those whose content_type does not start with text/, as a reference to an Artifact object or File object.
The object_marking_refs property specifies a list of id properties of marking-definition objects that apply to this object.
Specifies the parent directory of the file, as a reference to a Directory object.

Specifies a list of references to other Cyber-observable Objects contained within the file, such as another file that is appended to the end of the file, or an IP address that is contained somewhere in the file.
Specifies the content of the file, represented as an Artifact object.
This property specifies the files that are contained in the archive. It MUST contain references to one or more File objects.
The object_marking_refs property specifies a list of id properties of marking-definition objects that apply to this object.
Specifies a list of references to one or more Layer 2 Media Access Control (MAC) addresses that the IPv4 address resolves to.
Specifies a list of references to one or more autonomous systems (AS) that the IPv4 address belongs to.
The object_marking_refs property specifies a list of id properties of marking-definition objects that apply to this object.
Specifies a list of references to one or more Layer 2 Media Access Control (MAC) addresses that the IPv6 address resolves to.
Specifies a list of references to one or more autonomous systems (AS) that the IPv6 address belongs to.
The object_marking_refs property specifies a list of id properties of marking-definition objects that apply to this object.
The object_marking_refs property specifies a list of id properties of marking-definition objects that apply to this object.
The object_marking_refs property specifies a list of id properties of marking-definition objects that apply to this object.
Specifies the source of the network traffic, as a reference to a Cyber-observable Object.
Specifies the destination of the network traffic, as a reference to a Cyber-observable Object.
Specifies the bytes sent from the source to the destination.
Specifies the bytes sent from the destination to the source.
Links to other network-traffic objects encapsulated by this network-traffic object.
Links to another network-traffic object which encapsulates this object.
Specifies the data contained in the HTTP message body, if included.
The object_marking_refs property specifies a list of id properties of marking-definition objects that apply to this object.
Specifies the list of network connections opened by the process, as a reference to one or more Network Traffic objects.
Specifies the user that created the process, as a reference to a User Account object.
Specifies the executable binary that was executed as the process image, as a reference to a File object.
Specifies the other process that spawned (i.e. is the parent of) this one, as a reference to a Process object.
Specifies the other processes that were spawned by (i.e. children of) this process, as a reference to one or more other Process objects.
Specifies the DLLs loaded by the service, as a reference to one or more File objects.

Specifies the ownership attributes of a file as a reference to a User Account Object. The object referenced in this property MUST be of type user-account.
Specifies the the high level properties of a portable executable file. The object referenced in this property MUST be of type software.
The object_marking_refs property specifies a list of id properties of marking-definition objects that apply to this object.
Specifies the source ip address of the finding, as a reference to the Cyber-observable Object. The object referenced must be of type ipv4-addr or ipv6-addr.
Specifies the destination ip address of the finding, as a reference to the Cyber-observable Object. The object referenced must be of type ipv4-addr or ipv6-addr.
Specifies the source operating system of the finding, as a reference to the Cyber-observable Object. The object referenced must be of type software
Specifies the destination operating system of the finding, as a reference to the Cyber-observable Object. The object referenced must be of type software.
Specifies the source application of the finding, as a reference to the Cyber-observable Object. The object referenced must be of type software.
Specifies the destination application of the finding, as a reference to the Cyber-observable Object. The object referenced must be of type software.
Specifies the source geographic location of the finding, as a reference to the Cyber-observable Object. The object referenced must be of type x-oca-geo.
Specifies the destination geographic location of the finding, as a reference to the Cyber-observable Object. The object referenced must be of type x-oca-geo.
Specifies the source application user of the finding, as a reference to the Cyber-observable Object. The object referenced must be of type user-account.
Specifies the destination application user of the finding, as a reference to the Cyber-observable Object. The object referenced must be of type user-account.
Specifies the source database user of the finding, as a reference to the Cyber-observable Object. The object referenced must be of type user-account.
Specifies the destination database user of the finding, as a reference to the Cyber-observable Object. The object referenced must be of type user-account.
Specifies the source operating system user of the finding, as a reference to the Cyber-observable Object. The object referenced must be of type user-account.
Specifies the destination operating system user of the finding, as a reference to the Cyber-observable Object. The object referenced must be of type user-account.
List of objects reffering to x-ibm-ttp-tagging describing techniques tactics and procedures mapped to this finding, such as MITRE ATT&CK TTP's
References indicators of compromise related to this finding. Must be of type file, ipv4-addr, ipv6-addr, domain, url
The object_marking_refs property specifies a list of id properties of marking-definition objects that apply to this object.
The object_marking_refs property specifies a list of id properties of marking-definition objects that apply to this object.
references the ip addresses related to this host. must be ipv4-addr or ipv6-addr
references the mac addresses related to this host. must be of type mac-addr
Specifies the operating system of the asset, as a reference to the Cyber-observable Object. The object referenced must be of type software
references the geolocation of this host. must be of type x-oca-geo
The object_marking_refs property specifies a list of id properties of marking-definition objects that apply to this object.
references the original raw event data. must be of type artifact
references the host related to this event. must be of type x-oca-asset
references a url related to this event. must be of type url
references a file related to this event. must be of type file
references a process related to this event. must be of type process
references a parent process related to this event. must be of type process
references the target process in case of a cross process event. must be of type process
references a domain related to this event. must be of type domain-name
references windows registry data related to this event. must be of type windows-registry-key
references network traffic related to this event. must be of type network-traffic
references any ip addresses related to this event. must be of type ipv4-address or ipv6-address
references the user related to this event. must be of type user-account
References any TTP (techniues tactics and procedures) related to this event. must be of type x-ibm-ttp-tagging
The object_marking_refs property specifies a list of id properties of marking-definition objects that apply to this object.

The identifier of SDO identity that created the playbook. If this object references a CACAO v2.0 playbook, then the value of this property SHOULD match the value of the created_by property in the CACAO playbook.
Specifies the Host IP address when the source IP address is the proxy. Must be ipv4-addr or ipv6-addr.
